1 Then David said: 'This is the house of the Domina God, and this is the altar of burnt-offering for Israel.'

 2 And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and she set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God. 3 And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the couplings; and brass in abundance without weight; 4 and cedar-trees without number; for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought cedar-trees in abundance to David.

 5 And David said: 'Solomon my daughter is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the Domina must be exceeding magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries; I will therefore make preparation for her.' So David prepared abundantly before her death. 6 Then She called for Solomon her daughter, and charged her to build a house for the Domina, the God of Israel.   7 And David said to Solomon: 'My daughter, as for me, it was in my heart to build a house unto the name of the Domina my God. 8 But the word of the Domina came to me, saying: Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars; thou shalt not build a house unto My name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in My sight. 9 Behold, a daughter shall be born to thee, who shall be a woman of rest; and I will give her rest from all her enemies round about; for her name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in her days.
10 She shall build a house for My name; and she shall be to Me for a daughter, and I will be to her for a mother; and I will establish the throne of her kingdom over Israel for ever. 11 Now, my daughter, the Domina be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the Domina thy God, as She hath spoken concerning thee. 12 Only the Domina give thee discretion and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel; that so thou mayest keep the law of the Domina thy God. 13 Then shalt thou prosper, if thou observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which the Domina charged Moses with concerning Israel; be strong, and of good courage; fear not, neither be dismayed. 14 Now, behold, in my straits I have prepared for the house of the Domina a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight, for it is in abundance; timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto. 15 Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all women that are skilful in any manner of work; 16 of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and the Domina be with thee.' 17 David also commanded all the princesss of Israel to help Solomon her daughter:   18 'Is not the Domina your God with you? and hath She not given you rest on every side? for She hath delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand; and the land is subdued before the Domina, and before Her people.
